nav.div: Evesham Township School District » News » What's New » COVID-19 Information

div.div: COVID-19 School Closure, Preparedness Plan & Outside Facility Cancellations

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

p.span: The district has created a Google Site webpage to include all applicable information and communications as it relates to COVID-19. Click on the following link to access:

span.style: font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);
text-decoration: underline;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(28, 69, 135);

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(28, 69, 135);
font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

span.span: ETSD will continue to closely monitor all official communications regarding this health issue from the New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH), New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE), and the Center for Disease Control (CDC) and communicate any new information. Click here to view ETSD Emergency Preparedness Plan.

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px;

br.span:
We appreciate your continued cooperation in working with us to keep our students and staff healthy and virus-free. Please continue to communicate any issues with your building principal, school nurse, and/or school counselor. Student online learning opportunities were initiated on Monday, March 16th and will continue daily through Thursday, April 9th. Spring break will take place from Friday, April 10th to Friday, April 17th. Remote learning will resume on Monday morning, April 20th and continue through at least Friday, May 15th, as per the Governor's directive. Click here to review student expectation for online learning days.
Information and updates will be sent from the building principals and teachers/specialists directly. If you have questions about your child's continued learning plan while all students are temporarily working from home, please contact your building principal. If your child is having any issues related to technology or accessibility of resources, please contact your child's teacher or contact our tech support team directly at helpdesk@evesham.k12.nj.us. Be sure to include student name, teacher name, and a contact number in your email. There are copies of district student choice boards and other student resources on our Google Site that are open to the public. While every effort will be made to provide daily tech support, if there is a delay, we encourage students to use the Google Site student/parent resources to continue with learning tasks temporarily.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

br.span: While our schools are closed for students, all field trips, assemblies, and outside facility usage is also cancelled. Parents are encouraged to click here to view a variety of resources related to COVID-19, anxiety, working remotely, mental health services, and more. If your child qualifies for free or reduced lunch, weekly meals will be provided beginning the week of the 23rd. More information will be provided to qualifying parents directly from the Business Office.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial;
span.a: Click here to review parent communication regarding extended school closure sent home on April 16th.

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial;

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: All NJ residents are currently under the Governor's stay order and should remain home, except for essential travel, and practice social distancing at all times. Listed below are what families, students and staff can do to help reduce the spread of viruses in our school and community:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water. Use alcohol-based hand sanitizer, if soap and water are not available.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

ul.li: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands. coughs and sneezes with a tissue or sleeve, not your hands, discard the tissue and wash or sanitize hands.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

ul.li: Stay home if you are sick. Children who are sick should be kept home until they are fever free for 24 hours (with no medication) prior to returning to school.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

ul.li: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

ul.li: Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 10pt; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: In addition, if planning to travel, parents should review and follow CDC travel advisories. If you become ill after returning home, call your healthcare provider.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 10pt; white-space: pre-wrap; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

p.span: For official information regarding the coronavirus, please visit the following websites:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 32, 96); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;
